Bioinformatics and Systems Biology Graduate Student

My research focussed on developing and improving quantification and analysis algorithms for high-throughput genetic interaction mapping experiments in Saccharomyces cerevisiae. I developed both experimental assays as well as software packages that have pushed the limits of genetic screening technology.
Working with Dr. Mark Clement, I developed phylogeny construction and DNA motif-finding algorithms.

Working with Dr. Anindya Roy and a small group of fellow interns, we tested the hypothesis that the False Discovery Rate could be more accurately estimated using a mixture model. I key element of my contribution was the computational framework for testing our hypothesis.

The International Association for Machine Translation aims to bring together users, developers, researchers, sponsors, and other individuals or institutional or corporate entities interested in machine translation for the purpose of studying, evaluating, and understanding the science of machine translation and educating the public on important scientific techniques and principles of machine translation.  It is responsible to organize and hold a biannual MT Summit conference in odd years, the next one being in Seattle in 2021.
